selected_quotes: Zetaproteobacteria, get off my lawn. And don't even go there, Acidithiobacillia

citation.abstract: The order Acidithiobacillales was previously assigned to the class Gammaproteobacteria. Recent analyses have indicated that this order actually lies outside all the proteobacterial classes, as a sister group to the combined classes Betaproteobacteria and Gammaproteobacteria. We now confirm this result with multiprotein phylogenetic analysis of all the available genomes of members of the order Acidithiobacillales and representatives of all available bacterial orders, and propose the new proteobacterial class, Acidithiobacillia, with the type order Acidithiobacillales, comprising the families Acidithiobacillaceae and Thermithiobacillaceae with the type genus Acidithiobacillus.
citation.journal: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology
citation.title: Proposal for a new Class within the Proteobacteria, the Acidithiobacillia, with the Acidithiobacillales as the type Order.

author.name: Robert Beiko

wikipedia.title: Acidithiobacillales
wikipedia.summary: The Acidithiobacillales are an order of bacteria within the Class Acidithiobacillia and comprises the genera Acidithiobacillus and Thermithiobacillus.

wikipedia.title: Proteobacteria
wikipedia.summary: The Proteobacteria are a major group (phylum) of bacteria. They include a wide variety of pathogens, such as Escherichia, Salmonella, Vibrio, Helicobacter, and Yersinia, and many other notable genera.

wikipedia.title: Acidithiobacillia
wikipedia.summary: Acidithiobacillia is a proposed class of Proteobacteria. Its type order, Acidithiobacillales, was formerly classified within Gammaproteobacteria.

wikipedia.title: Acidithiobacillus
wikipedia.summary: Acidithiobacillus is a genus of Proteobacteria. Like all Proteobacteria, Acidithiobacillus is Gram-negative.

wikipedia.title: Acidithiobacillus thiooxidans
wikipedia.summary: Acidithiobacillus thiooxidans, formerly known as Thiobacillus thiooxidans until its reclassification into the newly designated genus Acidithiobacillus of the gamma subclass of Proteobacteria, is a Gram-negative, rod-shaped bacterium that uses sulfur as its
